meanings.definition: To insert a cannula into (a vein or body cavity)
meanings.sent1: The doctor will cannulate the patient's vein for the IV.
meanings.sent2: During surgery, the nurse will cannulate the artery carefully.
meanings.sent3: I tried to cannulate the juice box with a straw, but it didn't work!
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to cannulate my heart, piercing through my defenses.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand seemed to cannulate the box, making objects disappear.

meanings.definition: To make a hole or opening with a cannula
meanings.sent1: The plumber will cannulate the pipe to fix the leak.
meanings.sent2: The scientist will cannulate the container to release the gas slowly.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally cannulated the paper with a hole puncher.
meanings.sent4: His eyes seemed to cannulate the darkness, searching for any sign of light.
meanings.sent5: The key was able to cannulate the lock, opening the door to the hidden room.
